skillTree.localised_description: Furtive, scheming, sly, cunning, underhand, devious, conniving, double-dealing, and sneaky - valuable traits if you wish to stay alive!
All Skaven are unprincipled and untrustworthy by their foul natures. However, this is rarely a disadvantage in the face of the enemy.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say noâ€¦

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type

skillTree.localised_description: A sharp burst of wind slams into the enemy formation, disorienting them just as the Windspeaker intended.

target_if: Not on or below a platform

skillTree.localised_description: The weather of the Badlands bends to the Windspeaker's will, twisting and contorting under the lash of his warpstone-driven magics to scour his foes from the wastes.

effects.description:
All types of resistance are reduced by -5%
	(enemy armies in local region)

Campaign movement range: -10%
	(enemy armies in local province)

All types of resistance are reduced by -10%
	(enemy armies in local region)

Campaign movement range: -15%
	(enemy armies in local province)

skillTree.localised_description: The katabatic gusts of the Badlands speeds the Windspeaker hither and yon, making him appear as if he can teleport. It is merely the knowledge of how to ride the winds that makes him to seem to appear where he must.

effects.description:
Attribute: Vanguard Deployment
	(all units in army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

skillTree.localised_description: As the Windspeaker envelops his allies in the mysical shroud, it manifests as an ethereal barrier of shimmering sands that deflects and absorbs incoming attacks. For projectiles hurtling toward the protected allies, the sandstorm forms an elusive barrier that disrupts their trajectory, causing them to lose their accuracy and harmlessly dissipate within the swirling tempest.

The burst of scouring sand unleased by the Windspeaker targets both flesh and metal alike, exploiting weaknesses and vulnerabilities with relentless efficiency. The afflicted enemies experience a progressive deterioration of their combat capabilities, their movements slowing, and their resistance to further attacks diminishing. The mystical erosion induced by the gust manifests in visible wear and tear on armor, leaving foes vulnerable and disheartened.

When invoked, the Windspeaker channels the chaotic energies of the desert winds to conjure multiple swirling vortexes that dance across the sands with mesmerizing grace. Each vortex is a miniature tempest, spiraling with sand and arcane energies, creating an eerie symphony of howling winds that resonates throughout the battlefield.

target_if: Not on or below a platform

skillTree.localised_description: Whether by attachment or mutation, something nasty and spiky on your tail has got to bring no little advantage in battle.
What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Howling Warpgale"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Howling Warpgale Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Howling Warpgale Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: That moment of shock when an ambush is first sprung, that is the moment that Clan Gnaw lives for.
PLACEHOLDER

If this unit can hide at its current location it will not be spotted until the enemy is very close.

The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: PLACEHOLDER

Winds of Magic cost: -4 for "Brittle Bone Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Driven into battle by whips and humbled by chains, the only hope of a slave is a glorious death in battle.

effects.description:
Charge Bonus: +3 for Slave units
	(Lord's army)

Charge Bonus: +6 for Slave units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The core of any good army, always willing to serve, always willing to die, so that other more important rats can escape.

effects.description:
Weapon Strength: +5% for Clanrat units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon Strength: +10% for Clanrat units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The elite of Clan Gnaw's fighting forces always seem to know when to dodge a blow, and never get tired from hunting big beasts.

effects.description:
Vigour loss reduction: -12% for Big Game Hunter, Ambush Netter, and Boar Wrangler units
	(Lord's army)

Physical Resist: +5% for Big Game Hunter, Ambush Netter, and Boar Wrangler units
	(Lord's army)

Vigour loss reduction: -25% for Big Game Hunter, Ambush Netter, and Boar Wrangler units
	(Lord's army)

Physical Resist: +10% for Big Game Hunter, Ambush Netter, and Boar Wrangler units
	(Lord's army)

Vigour loss reduction: -50% for Big Game Hunter, Ambush Netter, and Boar Wrangler units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Let the fool-fools get in close. Smart rats fight from range!

effects.description:
Ammunition: +5% for Pig-Sticker, Dunedagger, Captured Rock Lobber, and Captured Spear Chukka units
	(Lord's army)

Missile Strength: +5% for Pig-Sticker, Dunedagger, Captured Rock Lobber, and Captured Spear Chukka units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +10% for Pig-Sticker, Dunedagger, Captured Rock Lobber, and Captured Spear Chukka units
	(Lord's army)

Missile Strength: +10% for Pig-Sticker, Dunedagger, Captured Rock Lobber, and Captured Spear Chukka units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +15% for Pig-Sticker, Dunedagger, Captured Rock Lobber, and Captured Spear Chukka units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Savage predators know little more than a headlong rush into combat. Smart Skaven stay well away when the beasts are crashing into combat.

effects.description:
Melee Attack: +2 for Rat, Scorpion, Wolf, Pig, and Sabretusk units
	(Lord's army)

Melee Attack: +4 for Rat, Scorpion, Wolf, Pig, and Sabretusk units
	(Lord's army)

Melee Defence: +3 for Rat, Scorpion, Wolf, Pig, and Sabretusk units
	(Lord's army)

Melee Attack: +6 for Rat, Scorpion, Wolf, Pig, and Sabretusk units
	(Lord's army)

Melee Defence: +6 for Rat, Scorpion, Wolf, Pig, and Sabretusk units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Wildspeakers of Clan Gnaw have long trained their captured flying units to act as scouts and spotters for the rest of Gnaw's forces.

effects.description:
Missile resistance: 3% for Vulture, Manticore, and Wyvern units
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 6% for Vulture, Manticore, and Wyvern units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +5% for Vulture, Manticore, and Wyvern units
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 12% for Vulture, Manticore, and Wyvern units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +10% for Vulture, Manticore, and Wyvern units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: In the vast expanse of the badlands, where danger lurks around every dune and crag, Clan Gnaw's finest hunters know the rule - always get the drop on the opponent, no matter the cost.

effects.description:
Magic Resist: +20% for Clanrat, Big Game Hunter, Ambush Netter, and Boar Wrangler units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Bonus vs Large: +8 for Clanrat, Big Game Hunter, Ambush Netter, and Boar Wrangler units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: From a far distant ridgetop comes a shower of bolts and boulders, the only sign that Clan Gnaw's ranged corps is active.

effects.description:
Reload time reduction: +10% for Pig-Sticker, Dunedagger, Captured Rock Lobber, and Captured Spear Chukka units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Range: +10% for Pig-Sticker, Dunedagger, Captured Rock Lobber, and Captured Spear Chukka units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Slave, beast, it's of no mind to the Overseers and Wildspeakers of Clan Gnaw. Send them in and let them let rush the enemy.

effects.description:
Physical Resist: +15% for Slave, Rat, Scorpion, Wolf, Pig, and Sabretusk units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile Resist: +12% for Slave, Rat, Scorpion, Wolf, Pig, and Sabretusk units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The flight of their prey brings the flying monsters of Clan Gnaw swooping down, intent upon eating their fill of the carrion before the other beasts arrive.

effects.description:
Ward save: 10% for Vulture, Manticore, and Wyvern units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon Strength: 15% for Vulture, Manticore, and Wyvern units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!
Such long-lived creatures develop a level of guile that mortals cannot match.
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
Keeping on top of things with an iron fist prevents Skavendom from becoming too much of a degenerate mess.
Naturally, rats get in everywhere â€“ even the tiniest opening presents little obstacle â€“ spreading their disease and corruption everywhere they can.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
This warrior has been ambushed previously and got themselves and many of their compatriots away safely. Such things make one naturally suspicious.
When making corpses of your foes, leave nothing of value for their kin to recover.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +5%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +10%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.
This unit can move hidden in any terrain.
Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.
This unit can move hidden in any terrain.
If this unit can hide at its current location it will not be spotted until the enemy is very close.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "I keep them sharp, yes-yes. Always ready for the challenge that I know is coming, yes-yes!"
"When they come for you, go straight for the throat and tear it clean out. They won't come again."
By their very nature, rats are very sneaky - even sneakier than Goblins. In fact, they're probably the sneakiest of all.
"Most precious of all substances, the pulse of our life."

effects.description:
Upkeep: -12% for Warpfire Thrower, Warp Lightning Cannon and Doomwheel units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Being fleet of foot is useful in a fightâ€¦ or when trying to get away afterwards!

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +10%
	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.
Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +15%

backgroundSkills.localised_description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.
Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.
